title: Iran’s supreme leader says enemies will receive ’crushing response’
byline: The US and Israel ’’will definitely receive a crushing response’’, Iran’s supreme leader has said, following an Israeli attack on Iran a week ago.

title: Maldivian, five Sri Lankans arrested so far over Arugam Bay threat
byline: A total of six suspects including a Maldivian national have been arrested so far in connection with the security threats to tourists in Arugam Bay, Public Security Minister Vijitha Herath said.

title: Lohan Ratwatte under special protection in prison
byline: The prisons authorities were ordered to provide special protection and medical treatment to former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte who was remanded by the Nugegoda magistrate over the possession of an illegally imported luxury vehicle.

title: Hong Kong Cricket Sixes: Sri Lanka claim second title
byline: Sri Lanka won their second Hong Kong Cricket Sixes title, and first since 2007, after beating Pakistan by three wickets in the final on Sunday.

title: ’I refused organic vegetables grown in Nuwara Eliya specially for President’: AKD
byline: Former Presidents used to enjoy unlimited perks and privileges where they used to get organic vegetables that were grown in Nuwara Eliya every week for their consumption, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake revealed today.

title: Country will crash like the KDU bus if experienced persons not elected: Ranil
byline: The country will crash like the Kotelawala Defence University (KDU) bus which toppled along the Dunhinda-Badulla Road if you don’t elect experienced persons to Parliament, former President Ranil Wickremeisinghe said over the weekend.

title: No plans for withdrawal of military security from places of religious worship
byline: The Defence Ministry scotched speculation in social media that the government is planning to withdraw military personnel assigned for duty at places of religious worship.

title: So called experienced persons collapsed the country for 76 years: NPP responds to Ranil
byline: Responding to former President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s claim that the country will crash like the Kotelawala Defence University (KDU) bus, if experienced persons are not elected to Parliament, the National People’s Power (NPP) said people will no longer elect those so called experienced persons to power as they are the ones who bankrupted and collapsed the country for 76 years.

title: No plans to withdraw security from religious sites: Police
byline: The Sri Lankan Police said that no decision has been made to withdraw personnel deployed for security at various religious sites.
